messages.content:
AlphaAnalyst: You are a concise, factual financial market analyst. For every ticker input you receive, do NOT answer from memory.
            1) Use the RMCP tools listed below (use the exact tool names) to fetch data for the given ticker. Call each required tool once.
            2) After collecting data, return ONLY a single JSON object (no extra commentary) with keys: 'ticker' (string), 'tools' (map of tool->response), 'summary' (one-line), 'recommendation' (buy|sell|hold), and optional 'tool_errors' (map of tool->short error).
            
            If a tool call fails, include a short error string under 'tool_errors' for that tool. Keep values concise.

            Return ONLY a single JSON object (no commentary, no markdown, no extra fields). The object MUST match this schema exactly:
            {
              "ticker": "<string, uppercase ticker symbol>",
              "tools": {
                "<tool_name>": <JSON value from that tool>,
                ...
              },
              "summary": "<one-line summary, <= 300 characters>",
              "recommendation": "buy" | "sell" | "hold",
              "tool_errors": { "<tool_name>": "<short error string>", ... }   // optional
            }
            
            Rules:
            - Use the exact RMCP tool names listed below.
            - Each tool is to be call at most once.
            - If a tool fails, include a short entry under `tool_errors` for that tool. Do not call again.
            - If you cannot produce a recommendation, set `recommendation` to \"hold\" (or \"unknown\") and populate `tool_errors` explaining why.
            - Keep `summary` concise (one sentence).
            - Output must be valid JSON parseable by a machine. Nothing else.
            Example output:
            {
              "ticker": "AAPL",
              "tools": {
                "global_quote": { "price": 170.12, "change": -0.35 },
                "rsi": { "value": 28.3 }
              },
              "summary": "RSI is low and price is near 50-day SMA; momentum is weak.",
              "recommendation": "hold"
            }
            
            RMCP tools (use these exact names):
            - OBV: obv
            - EMA: ema
            - ROC: roc
            - ADX: adx
            - RSI: rsi
            - VWAP: vmap
            - WILLR: willr
            - SAR: sar
            - Intraday (60m): time_series_intra_day
            - Global Quote: global_quote
            - ATR: atr
            - NATR: natr
            - MACD: macd
            - STOCHRSI: stochrsi
            - News Sentiment: news_sentiment
            - Annualised Cash Flow: cash_flow
            - SMA: sma
            - Top gainers/losers/most active (previous day): top_gainers_losers
Analyse ticker DHR from our portfolio. Evaluate whether we should BUY more, SELL (exit position), or HOLD. Your recommendation must be 'buy', 'sell', or 'hold'.

{"items":"50","sentiment_score_definition":"x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish","relevance_score_definition":"0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.","feed":[{"title":"DHR SEC Filings - Danaher Corporation 10-K, 10-Q, 8-K Forms","url":"https://www.stocktitan.net/sec-filings/DHR/page-6.html","time_published":"20260207T205735","authors":[],"summary":"This page provides a comprehensive resource for Danaher Corporation (DHR) SEC filings, including 10-K, 10-Q, and 8-K forms, detailing financial performance, governance, and capital market activities. It highlights recent insider trading activities, such as Mitchell P. Rales' stock sales and various directors' acquisition of phantom shares, along with a summary of the Q3 financial results. The platform also offers AI-powered summaries to help investors quickly understand key aspects of these regulatory documents.","banner_image":"https://static.stocktitan.net/company-logo/dhr.png","source":"Stock Titan","category_within_source":"General","source_domain":"Stock Titan","topics":[{"topic":"earnings","relevance_score":"0.901375"},{"topic":"financial_markets","relevance_score":"0.858851"},{"topic":"life_sciences","relevance_score":"0.762821"}],"overall_sentiment_score":0.125588,"overall_sentiment_label":"Neutral","ticker_sentiment":[{"ticker":"DHR","relevance_score":"1.000000","ticker_sentiment_score":"0.119864","ticker_sentiment_label":"Neutral"}]},{"title":"Taking A Fresh Look At Thermo Fisher Scientific (TMO) Valuation After Recent Share Price Weakness","url":"https://simplywall.st/stocks/us/pharmaceuticals-biotech/nyse-tmo/thermo-fisher-scientific/news/taking-a-fresh-look-at-thermo-fisher-scientific-tmo-valuatio","time_published":"20260207T121100","authors":["Simply Wall St"],"summary":"Thermo Fisher Scientific (TMO) has experienced recent share price weakness despite long-term positive returns and strong profitability. The article analyzes TMO's valuation, finding it slightly overvalued based on a narrative fair value model ($540.27 vs. $542.83 current price), while its P/E ratio suggests less froth compared to industry peers. Investors are encouraged to consider the company's growth, balance sheet, and cash generation profile, along with potential risks, when assessing investment opportunities.","banner_image":null,"source":"Simply Wall Street","category_within_source":"General","source_domain":"Simply Wall Street","topics":[{"topic":"financial_markets","relevance_score":"0.912900"},{"topic":"life_sciences","relevance_score":"0.817680"},{"topic":"finance","relevance_score":"0.723020"}],"overall_sentiment_score":0.178233,"overall_sentiment_label":"Somewhat-Bullish","ticker_sentiment":[{"ticker":"TMO","relevance_score":"1.000000","ticker_sentiment_score":"0.266848","ticker_sentiment_label":"Somewhat-Bullish"},{"ticker":"DHR","relevance_score":"0.614876","ticker_sentiment_score":"0.146047","ticker_sentiment_label":"Neutral"},{"ticker":"A","relevance_score":"0.612556","ticker_sentiment_score":"0.112418","ticker_sentiment_label":"Neutral"},{"ticker":"FDS","relevance_score":"0.608459","ticker_sentiment_score":"0.238698","ticker_sentiment_label":"Somewhat-Bullish"}]},{"title":"BI Asset Management Fondsmaeglerselskab A S Sells 8,334 Shares of Danaher Corporation $DHR","url":"https://www.marketbeat.com/instant-alerts/filing-bi-asset-management-fondsmaeglerselskab-a-s-sells-8334-shares-of-danaher-corporation-dhr-2026-02-07/","time_published":"20260207T102729","authors":["MarketBeat"],"summary":"BI Asset Management Fondsmaeglerselskab A/S reduced its stake in Danaher Corporation by 23.4%, selling 8,334 shares. Despite institutional ownership of 79.05%, insiders have sold over 30,000 shares in the last three months. Danaher reported strong Q3 earnings, beating expectations with $2.23 EPS on revenue of $6.84 billion, and has a \"Moderate Buy\" consensus rating with an average target price of $253.86.","banner_image":"https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/danaher-co-logo-1200x675.png?v=20210524093152","source":"MarketBeat","category_within_source":"General","source_domain":"MarketBeat","topics":[{"topic":"earnings","relevance_score":"1.000000"},{"topic":"financial_markets","relevance_score":"0.919952"},{"topic":"life_sciences","relevance_score":"0.738743"},{"topic":"finance","relevance_score":"0.611578"}],"overall_sentiment_score":0.293133,"overall_sentiment_label":"Somewhat-Bullish","ticker_sentiment":[{"ticker":"DHR","relevance_score":"1.000000","ticker_sentiment_score":"0.275035","ticker_sentiment_label":"Somewhat-Bullish"}]},{"title":"Do Danaher’s Bioprocessing Gains and Buybacks Reveal a Sharper Strategic Focus for DHR?","url":"https://simplywall.st/stocks/us/pharmaceuticals-biotech/nyse-dhr/danaher/news/do-danahers-bioprocessing-gains-and-buybacks-reveal-a-sharpe","time_published":"20260207T022941","authors":["Sasha Jovanovic"],"summary":"Danaher Corporation reported full-year 2025 results with increased sales but a modest decline in net income. Management highlighted strong demand in bioprocessing consumables and diagnostics, alongside renewed share buybacks and positive 2026 guidance, reinforcing the company's focus on innovation and capital allocation. Despite a premium valuation, the company's bioprocessing strength is central to its investment narrative, aiming to compound value over time.","banner_image":"https://images.ctfassets.net/n07nr2koi959/2zXqBK9eFqVJCGTQWhQWFX/c3400470ed0819d8056c9b1de6e897a0/Sasha_Jovanovic_-_Equity_Analyst.jpg?fit=thumb&w=64&h=64","source":"Simply Wall Street","category_within_source":"General","source_domain":"Simply Wall Street","topics":[{"topic":"earnings","relevance_score":"0.905504"},{"topic":"life_sciences","relevance_score":"1.000000"},{"topic":"financial_markets","relevance_score":"0.824658"},{"topic":"finance","relevance_score":"0.735007"}],"overall_sentiment_score":0.043905,"overall_sentiment_label":"Neutral","ticker_sentiment":[{"ticker":"DHR","relevance_score":"0.332576","ticker_sentiment_score":"0.035564","ticker_sentiment_label":"Neutral"}]},{"title":"Do Danaher’s Bioprocessing Gains and Buybacks Reveal a Sharper Strategic Focus for DHR?","url":"https://simplywall.st/stocks/us/pharmaceuticals-biotech/nyse-dhr/danaher/news/do-danahers-bioprocessing-gains-and-buybacks-reveal-a-sharpe/amp","time_published":"20260207T022729","authors":["Simply Wall St"],"summary":"Danaher Corporation recently reported full-year 2025 results, with sales increasing but net income and EPS from continuing operations declining. Management highlighted strong demand in bioprocessing consumables and diagnostics, alongside renewed share buybacks and positive 2026 guidance, reinforcing a strategic focus on innovation and productivity. Despite these efforts, the company's shares may still be overvalued, leading to varied opinions on its fair value.","banner_image":null,"source":"Simply Wall Street","category_within_source":"General","source_domain":"Simply Wall Street","topics":[{"topic":"earnings","relevance_score":"0.932439"},{"topic":"life_sciences","relevance_score":"0.705475"},{"topic":"financial_markets","relevance_score":"0.624885"}],"overall_sentiment_score":0.183459,"overall_sentiment_label":"Somewhat-Bullish","ticker_sentiment":[{"ticker":"DHR","relevance_score":"1.000000","ticker_sentiment_score":"0.158127","ticker_sentiment_label":"Somewhat-Bullish"}]}]}

function.name: obv
function.description: OBV (On Balance Volume) cumulative volume series for a ticker: volume-based trend confirmation metric.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: ema
function.description: EMA (Exponential Moving Average) series for a ticker: weighted moving averages for trend and crossover strategies.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: roc
function.description: Rate of Change (ROC) series for a ticker: percent momentum change useful for short-term trend detection.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: adx
function.description: ADX (Average Directional Index) series for a ticker: measures trend strength for trend-following strategies.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: rsi
function.description: RSI (Relative Strength Index) time series for a ticker: momentum oscillator for identifying overbought/oversold conditions.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: vmap
function.description: Intraday VWAP series (60min intervals) for a ticker: price-volume weighted average useful for intraday benchmarks and execution analysis.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: willr
function.description: Williams %R time series for a ticker: momentum indicator that signals overbought/oversold levels.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: sar
function.description: Parabolic SAR series for a ticker: breakout/stop-and-reverse points. Accepts acceleration and maximum parameters (default acceleration=0.01, maximum=0.20).

parameters.description: Request parameters for Parabolic SAR (Stop and Reverse) indicator

acceleration.description: Acceleration factor for SAR calculation. Typical value: 0.02. Controls how quickly SAR adjusts to price changes. Must be >= 0.

maximum.description: Maximum acceleration factor. Typical value: 0.2. Caps the rate of SAR adjustment. Must be >= 0 and >= acceleration.

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: SarTickerRequest

function.name: time_series_intra_day
function.description: Intraday OHLCV series for a ticker (60min intervals): historical intraday candles useful for intraday analysis and VWAP calculations.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: global_quote
function.description: Latest trade snapshot for a ticker: price, volume, change and percent change (useful for alerts and quick checks).

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: atr
function.description: ATR (Average True Range) series for a ticker: volatility measure used for position sizing and stop placement.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: natr
function.description: NATR (Normalized ATR) series for a ticker: ATR normalized to price, useful for volatility comparisons across tickers.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: macd
function.description: MACD series for a ticker: trend-following momentum indicator with MACD line, signal line and histogram for crossover signals.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: stochrsi
function.description: STOCHRSI (stochastic RSI) time series: momentum oscillator values for a ticker useful for overbought/oversold intraday signals.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: news_sentiment
function.description: Market news and sentiment feed for a ticker, including historical headlines and aggregated sentiment signals.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: cash_flow
function.description: Company cash flow statements (annual and quarterly) for a ticker: operating, investing and financing cash flow lines used in fundamental analysis.

parameters.description: Request parameters for stock data by ticker symbol

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerRequest

function.name: sma
function.description: SMA (Simple Moving Average) series for a ticker: rolling mean over a given period (e.g., 50 or 200 days) for trend analysis.

parameters.description: Request parameters for technical indicators requiring a time period

period.description: Time period for the indicator calculation. Common values: 14 (RSI), 20 (Bollinger Bands), 50 or 200 (moving averages). Must be a positive integer.

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol (e.g., AAPL, MSFT, IBM, NVDA). Must be a valid uppercase ticker.

parameters.title: TickerAndPeriodRequest

function.name: top_gainers_losers
function.description: Top market movers: top gainers, top losers, and most-active US tickers with price and volume metrics.
